content: I also wrote a response to the same piece, which can be found here. He blocked me as well. The reason this is such a problem, as you mention, is because when an author blocks a user, the blocked user’s response is no longer visible under the original story. This allows authors to select which responses their followers will and will not see. Such a tactic is beyond cowardly and it is difficult to believe that any self-respecting writer would engage in such behavior. Any serious writer with an ounce of confidence would gladly allow open criticism of their work.
